categories.name: expert
categories.description: a specialized user with deep understanding of the corpus

categories.name: novice
categories.description: a regular user with no understanding of specialized terms

categories.name: factoid
categories.description: question seeking a specific, concise piece of information or a short fact about a particular subject, such as a name, date, or number

categories.name: open-ended
categories.description: question inviting detailed or exploratory responses, encouraging discussion or elaboration

categories.name: direct
categories.description: question that does not contain any premise or any information about the user

categories.name: with-premise
categories.description: question starting with a very short premise, where the user reveals their needs or some information about themselves

categories.name: concise-and-natural
categories.description: phrased in the way people typically speak, reflecting everyday language use, without formal or artificial structure. It is a concise direct question consisting of less than 10 words

categories.name: verbose-and-natural
categories.description: phrased in the way people typically speak, reflecting everyday language use, without formal or artificial structure. It is a relatively long question consisting of more than 9 words

categories.name: short-search-query
categories.description: phrased as a typed web query for search engines (only keywords, without punctuation and without a natural-sounding structure). It consists of less than 7 words

categories.name: long-search-query
categories.description: phrased as a typed web query for search engines (only keywords, without punctuation and without a natural-sounding structure). It consists of more than 6 words

categories.name: similar-to-document
categories.description: phrased using the same terminology and phrases appearing in the document

categories.name: distant-from-document
categories.description: phrased using terms completely different from the ones appearing in the document
